intro: Cyrtanthera calcarata, commonly known as the sandstone lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Cyrtanthera calcarata is an important species in ecological studies due to its unique adaptations to extreme climates.
